tool_description: The TextMaster is a suite of text manipulation services that can be used in your applications. It provides functionalities such as reversing text, converting text to uppercase or lowercase, counting words, counting characters, counting sentences, and generating a text summary.
name: TextMaster
title: TextMaster

api_list.name: /reverse
api_list.description: This endpoint takes a string as input and returns the string in reverse order. Useful for various text processing and manipulation tasks.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://textmaster.p.rapidapi.com/reverse"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "textmaster.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: /uppercase
api_list.description: This endpoint receives a string and transforms all characters to uppercase. Ideal for uniform text formatting or case-insensitive operations.
api_list.code:

            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "textmaster.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: /charcount
api_list.description: This endpoint counts the total number of characters in a provided string. Helpful for understanding text length or limiting the size of input.
api_list.code:

url = "https://textmaster.p.rapidapi.com/charcount"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "textmaster.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: /wordcount
api_list.description: This endpoint calculates the number of words in a given string. Beneficial for text analysis, readability scoring, and more.

        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: /sentencecount

api_list.name: /summary
api_list.description: This endpoint receives a string and generates a brief summary based on its content. It's a handy tool for content management, text analysis, and summarizing large amounts of text.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://textmaster.p.rapidapi.com/summary"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "textmaster.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
